00032 #ifndef SPEBM_H_
00033 #define SPEBM_H_
00034 
00035 #include "libeblearn.h"
00036 #include "libspidx.h"
00037 
00038 namespace ebl {
00039 
00040   /*****************************************
00041    * This is the beginning of the reimplementation of Ebm
00042    * for spIdxs. However the modules presented aren't as
00043    * tunable as the ones in Ebm, due to the limitations
00044    * of the current model chosen for the spIdx
00045    * (such as the select operation that creates a new spidx
00046    * instead of a pointer to a part of the original spidx)
00047    */
00048 
00050 class state_spidx: public state_idx {
00051 public:
00052 
00053 
00055         spIdx<double> x;
00057         spIdx<double> dx;
00059         spIdx<double> ddx;
00060 
00061 
00064         state_spidx();
00065 
00067         state_spidx(intg s0, intg s1 = -1, intg s2 = -1, intg s3 = -1, intg s4 = -1, intg s5 = -1, intg s6 = -1, intg s7 = -1);
00068 
00072         state_spidx(parameter *st, intg Nelem, intg s0 = -1, intg s1 = -1, intg s2 = -1, intg s3 = -1, intg s4 = -1, intg s5 = -1, intg s6 = -1, intg s7 = -1);
00073 
00074         virtual ~state_spidx();
00075 
00077         void clear();
00078 
00080         void clear_dx();
00081 
00083         void clear_ddx();
00084 
00086         intg nelements();
00087 
00089         intg footprint(){ ylerror("Not implemented for state_spidx"); return 0;}
00090 
00092         intg size(){ ylerror("Not implemented for state_spidx"); return 0;}
00093 
00095         void update_gd(gd_param &arg);
00096 
00098         void resize(intg s0 = -1, intg s1 = -1, intg s2 = -1, intg s3 = -1,
00099                         intg s4 = -1, intg s5 = -1, intg s6 = -1, intg s7 = -1);
00100 
00101         void resizeAs(state_spidx &s);
00102 
00103         void resize(const intg* dimsBegin, const intg* dimsEnd){ ylerror("Not implemented for state_spidx");}
00104 
00106         state_spidx make_spcopy();
00107         state_idx make_copy(){ylerror("Make_copy not implemented for state_spidx, use make_spcopy instead"); state_idx bla; return bla;}
00108 };
00109 
00111 // linear module
00112 // it is different from the eblearn version in that it takes spidx
00113 // as input and output.
00114 // still, the weights are not sparse
00115 // The input and output must be of order 1
00116 
00117 class sp_linear_module: public module_1_1<state_idx, state_idx> {
00118 public:
00119         state_idx *w;
00120         Idx<intg> *table;
00121 
00122         virtual ~sp_linear_module();
00123         sp_linear_module(parameter *p, Idx<intg>* connection_table, intg in, intg out);
00124         void fprop(state_spidx *in, state_spidx *out);
00125         void bprop(state_spidx *in, state_spidx *out);
00126         void bbprop(state_spidx *in, state_spidx *out);
00127         void forget(forget_param_linear &fp);
00128         void normalize();
00129 };
00130 
00131 
00132 // this module performs -log(softmax) on the input
00133 // it also computes the winning class (idx_min(output))
00134 // and computes the energy
00135 // The input and output must be of order 1
00136 
00137 class sp_logsoftmax_module : public module_1_1< state_idx, state_idx > {
00138 public:
00139         Idx<ubyte> classindex2label; 
00140         double beta;
00141 
00142         sp_logsoftmax_module(double b, Idx<ubyte> *classes);
00143         ~sp_logsoftmax_module(){}
00144 
00145         void fprop(state_spidx *in, state_spidx *out);
00146         void bprop(state_spidx *in, state_spidx *out);
00147 
00148         void calc_energy(state_spidx *out, Idx<ubyte> *desired, state_idx *energy);
00149         void calc_max(state_spidx *out, class_state *output);
00150 };
00151 
00152 
00153 }
